The Cult of Orpheus

The night descends, the Sun has set, and you walk the streets in the direction of the place where you are to be initiated. Suddenly, you find yourself lost, in front of a grove awash in a pale light, as if lit by a thousand candles.\n You venture in, and you find yourself on a path guarded by men wearing masks of different animals. "We are the souls hunted by Zagreus", they say, "We are One with Dionysos. We are those who followed the Christ into Hades and returned". At the end of the path is the Mystagogue, a man ten feet tall. He sacrifices three animals and bathes a white-clad woman in their blood. The candles give out a strange smell, and you feel dizzy. The men around you seem to twitch and shiver at the corners of your eyes. And there, the Mystagogue puts his hand on the woman's head and she falls down in a trance.\n

He then looks at you, half bloody, and says: "We are the Orpheotelestai, we see all paths and we see into everyone's soul. We have seen great promise in you. The path ahead is hard and full of mystery, but the reward could be priceless. We learn to become immortal, to become One with the Divine, to master Death. We invite you to our circle" - Then the candles burst out and give the light of ten suns, and the Mystagogue is covered in flames, and says with an otherworldly voice: "Do you accept following our rite? Will you seize Eternity?"
The Cult of Serapis
